con:testCase.con:description:
21 April 2:30 Using Soap UI VERSION: 1.2.2pr4
The number of transactions recieved by Menu + $ grep handleUSSDRequest /opt/cs-upi/menu-plus/log/menu-plus.log | wc -l
Menu+ Too Busy cs@testlab-sparc:/opt/cs-upi/menu-plus/log [0] za/cs/ussdgw/lab $ cat /opt/cs-upi/menu-plus/log/menu-plus.log |grep '>4001<' | wc -l 896
3104+896=4000
PCC Too busy (sent to PCC and PCC responded that it was too busy) cs@testlab-sparc:/opt/pcc/log [0] za/cs/ussdgw/lab $ cat /opt/cs-upi/menu-plus/log/menu-plus.log |grep '>4002<' | wc -l 346
The number of transactions sent to PCC (Menu+ trying to send to PCC) $ cat /opt/cs-upi/menu-plus/log/menu-plus.log |grep 'HUX Relay' | wc -l 1220
852+346=1198
//The number of transactions recieved by PCC /// grep "124:" ASH.1.1.pcc.log | wc -l // 852
PCC successfully completed transactions (recieved, processed and compted successfully) $ grep "xrstub" ASH.1.1.pcc.log | wc -l 860
Number of read time outs in menuplus (went into PCC but there was no answer and there is no record of them in the log) $ cat /opt/cs-upi/menu-plus/log/menu-plus.log |grep -i 'read timed out' | wc -l 59
346 + 837 + 59=1242
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
22 April 8:30 using ./ss7-lab-run hlrussdmo mo_batch rsp VERSION: 1.2.2pr4
The number of transactions recieved by Menu + $ grep handleUSSDRequest /opt/cs-upi/menu-plus/log/menu-plus.log | wc -l 1154
Menu+ Too Busy cs@testlab-sparc:/opt/cs-upi/menu-plus/log [0] za/cs/ussdgw/lab $ cat /opt/cs-upi/menu-plus/log/menu-plus.log |grep '>4001<' | wc -l 0
3104+896=4000
PCC Too busy (sent to PCC and PCC responded that it was too busy) cs@testlab-sparc:/opt/pcc/log [0] za/cs/ussdgw/lab $ cat /opt/cs-upi/menu-plus/log/menu-plus.log |grep '>4002<' | wc -l 0
The number of transactions sent to PCC (Menu+ trying to send to PCC) $ cat /opt/cs-upi/menu-plus/log/menu-plus.log |grep 'HUX Relay' | wc -l 144
//The number of transactions recieved by PCC /// grep "124:" ASH.1.1.pcc.log | wc -l // 852
PCC successfully completed transactions (recieved, processed and compted successfully) $ grep "xrstub" ASH.1.1.pcc.log | wc -l 196
Number of read time outs in menuplus (went into PCC but there was no answer and there is no record of them in the log) $ cat /opt/cs-upi/menu-plus/log/menu-plus.log |grep -i 'read timed out' | wc -l 0
ResponseCode=901,USSDResponseString=Sorry, Another transaction for your number is in progress, please try again in a minute.,TransactionTime=20150422T08:47:22 cat /opt/cs-upi/menu-plus/log/menu-plus.log |grep -i 'ResponseCode=901' | wc -l 35
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
22 April 9:30 using SoapUI VERSION: 1.2.1
The number of transactions recieved by Menu + $ grep handleUSSDRequest /opt/cs-upi/menu-plus/log/menu-plus.log | wc -l 3296
Menu+ Too Busy cs@testlab-sparc:/opt/cs-upi/menu-plus/log [0] za/cs/ussdgw/lab $ cat /opt/cs-upi/menu-plus/log/menu-plus.log |grep '>4001<' | wc -l 704
PCC Too busy (sent to PCC and PCC responded that it was too busy) cs@testlab-sparc:/opt/pcc/log [0] za/cs/ussdgw/lab $ cat /opt/cs-upi/menu-plus/log/menu-plus.log |grep '>4002<' | wc -l 378
The number of transactions sent to PCC (Menu+ trying to send to PCC) $ cat /opt/cs-upi/menu-plus/log/menu-plus.log |grep 'HUX Relay' | wc -l 1373
//The number of transactions recieved by PCC /// grep "124:" ASH.1.1.pcc.log | wc -l // 974
PCC successfully completed transactions (recieved, processed and compted successfully) $ grep "xrstub" ASH.1.1.pcc.log | wc -l 995
Number of read time outs in menuplus (went into PCC but there was no answer and there is no record of them in the log) $ cat /opt/cs-upi/menu-plus/log/menu-plus.log |grep -i 'read timed out' | wc -l 107
//ResponseCode=901,USSDResponseString=Sorry, Another transaction for your number is in progress, please try again in a minute.,TransactionTime=20150422T08:47:22 //cat /opt/cs-upi/menu-plus/log/menu-plus.log |grep -i 'ResponseCode=901' | wc -l
------------------------------------------------------------- Testing the ESTABLISHED, CLOSE_WAIT and TIME_WAIT connections
$ cat server.properties ## Menu+ Server Config Values - - - #Wed Apr 08 12:27:01 SAST 2015 ServiceCallConnectTimeOut=2500 SessionTimeOut=60000 CullFrequency=10000 WorkerThreads=2 AcceptLimit=16 ServiceCallReadTimeOut=10000 ReserveThreads=1
VERSION: 1.2.1 ESTABLISHED = 278 CLOSE_WAIT = 0 TIME_WAIT = 500
VERSION: 1.2.2pr4 ESTABLISHED = 306 CLOSE_WAIT = 103 TIME_WAIT = 12000
Please note that all return codes below 100 are treated as success. These codes are send back from PCC and recorded in EDR files and the following describes when which code will be sent back:. SUCCESS 1 - The purchase, status, extension, cancellation, migration, autorenewal, etc action was successful. HELP 2 - Subscriber dialled the Help Code , generally *shortcode# and PCC responded with the help message CONFIRMATION 11 - Used upon cancellation or purchase of a promotion when PCC responds with a message for a subscriber to confirm the purchase or cancellation request with 1 MENU 12 - PCC responded with a Menu with options for the subscriber to choose from PROMPT_PIN 13 - PCC asked a subscriber who is doing a gift subscription to enter his/her pin code.
All The below cases are rejection cases INVALID_USSD_FORMAT 955 - subscriber sent an invalid USSD string to PCC which does not match any known format or options. REJ_FUNDS_SUBSCRIBE 112 - Purchase of a new subscription was rejected due to the subscriber not having enough funds REJ_CANCEL_NOT_CONFIRMED 131 - when a subscriber was prompted to confirm the cancellation request of an existing subscription and the subscriber decided to not go ahead with the cancellation (responded with something other that "1") REJ_SUBSCRIBE_NOT_CONFIRMED 141 - when a subscriber was prompted to confirm the purchase request of a new/existing subscription and the subscriber decided to not go ahead with the purchase (responded with something other that "1") REJ_MIGRATION 913 - when a subscriber having an existing active subscription tries to purchase (migrate to) another subscription which is not allowed by configuration REJ_EXTEND_NOT_ALLOWED 914 - when a subscriber having an existing subscription tries to purchase the same subscription again but it is not allowed by configuration REJ_POSTPAID 952 - when a subscriber that cannot be found on AIR tries to access any options in PCC when it is not allowed. REJ_INVALID_CLASS 953 - when a subscriber that is in an invalid service class based on what is allowed on the Promotion Family level tries to access the promotion family. REJ_STATUS_INACTIVE 954 - when a subscriber whose supervision expiry date is in the past or is marked as inactive tries to access any options in PCC REJ_INVALID_PSO_STATE 1912 - when rejections are set up for the promotion family for PSO bits and the rejection rule triggers on initial purchase attempt for the subscriber REJ_INVALID_COMMUNITY 1913 - when rejections are set up for the promotion family for Community IDs and the rejection rule triggers on initial purchase attempt for the subscriber REJ_MAX_EXTENSION 1915 - when a subscriber who has an active subscription tries to purchase it again, and the action configured for extension is update (the subscription validity period will be added to the current validity period that is left for the subscription), but the new expiry date of the subscription is further in the future than the configured limit for this validity period and the configured action is set to reject the purchase in this case. REJ_INVALID_EMA_STATE 1914 - Same scenarios as as for REJ_INVALID_COMMUNITY but this time it is about the state of variables accessible via EMA REJ_NOT_ON_WHITELIST 1916 - When white-listing is required for a promotion and a subscriber who is not on the white-list tries to purchase the promotion REJ_INVALID_OFFER_ID 1957 - Same scenarios as as for REJ_INVALID_COMMUNITY but this time it is about Offer IDs REJ_INVALID_MENU_OPTION 956 - A subscriber choses an option which is not presented on a menu REJ_MENU_EXIT 958 - A subscriber decides to exit a menu presented REJ_MAX_PACKAGES 917 - When Multiple Coexisting promotions option for multi-package options is used for a promotion family and the subscriber already has the maximum configured number of active subscriptions in the family and tries to purchase another new subscription REJ_COEXISTENCE 919 - When Multiple Coexisting promotions option for multi-package options is used and a subscriber with one or more active subscriptions in the promotion family attempts to purchase another one which is not allowed based on configuration of the subscriptions already owned. REJ_SUBSCRIPTION_LIMIT 920 - Generally used in conjunction with free subscriptions when a subscriber is limited to a number of free subscriptions per period and the subscriber tries to subscribe more times than his allowed quota for the current period REJ_DA_CONDITION 950 - when one or more Dedicated accounts have a non-zero value on one or more of the following actions: subscription, extension(repurchase) or migration REJ_UA_CONDITION 951 - Same as REJ_DA_CONDITION but this time related to Usage accumulators REJ_INVALID_PIN 921 - subscriber trying to purchase a gift subscription and who was prompted for his/her pin entered the incorrect pin code REJ_EXCEPTION_CLS 100 - A subscriber is in one of the service classes that is not allowed for which there are special messages to tell these subscribers they are not allowed, like MTN Staff not being allowed to purchase MTN Promotions getting a message like "Sorry: MTN Staff is not allowed to buy any of these bundles" REJ_NOT_SUBSCRIBED 101 - When a subscriber who is not subscribed to s specific promotion tries to get the status or tries to cancel a subscription to that promotion REJ_MISSING_COMM_ID_AUTORENEW 1 - when auto-renewal is rejected due to a subscriber not having a community ID which was provisioned on subscription to a promotion REJ_FUNDS_AUTORENEW 111 - when auto-renewal is rejected due to a subscriber not having enough funds REJ_ACCOUNT_ACCESS_DENIED 253 - When a third party to a gift subscription tries to get the status, cancel, extend, or migrate away from a subscription which he/she is not the owner or initial buyer. REJ_INVALID_MSISDNB 351 - for gift subscriptions when the purchaser enters the receiver's number but the number is either offnet, too short, too long or not numeric REJ_PSO_STATE_AUTORENEW 912 - when auto-renewal is rejected due to a subscriber who had certain PSO bits provisioned on subscription and these bits are found to be in a different state REJ_TOO_BUSY 998 - When the service is too busy REJ_SYSTEM_ERROR 999 OK REJ_OFFER_ID_INV_AUTORENEW 957 - when auto-renewal is rejected due to a subscriber who had certain Offer IDs provisioned on subscription and one or more of these Offer Ids are not found on the subscribers account REJ_TOO_MANY_COMMUNITIES 1101 - When a subscriber already has 3 community IDs attached to his/her account on AIR and the subscriber tries to purchase a subscription which would have attached one more REJ_MISSING_COMM_ID_EXTEND 1102 - when a subscriber who has an active subscription for which a community Id was provisioned on subscription tries to repurchase (exctend) and the community ID is not found on the subscriber's account on AIR REJ_COMM_ID_EXISTS 1103 - When a subscriber tries to purchase a promotion which would attach a Community ID to his/her account on AIR but the specific Community ID is found to be already attached to his/her account REJ_INVALID_PSO_SUBSCRIBED 912 - When a subscriber who has an active subscription that involves Personal Service Offering Bits (PSO bits, otherwise known as segmentation) tries to purchase the same subscription again or is in the process of having his/her subscription renewed and it is found that the state of his/her PSO bits are not as they are supposed to be
while true; do ~/ss7-lab-run hlrussdmo ~/mo_batch.big ~/rsp; sleep 5; done
